contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Mitsugi'''|御調町|Mitsugi-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Mitsugi District, Hiroshima|Mitsugi District]], [[Hiroshima Prefecture|Hiroshima]], [[Japan]]. On March 28, 2005 Mitsugi, along with the town of [[Mukaishima, Hiroshima|Mukaishima]], also from [[Mitsugi District, Hiroshima|Mitsugi District]], was merged into the city of [[Onomichi, Hiroshima|Onomichi]]. As of 2004, the town had an estimated population of 8,144 and the density of 98.14 persons per km². The total area was 82.98 km². Mitsugi is divided into seven areas: *Kamikawabe *Ichi *Kawachi *Imatsuno *Ayame *Yamato *Sugano. Points of interest in the town include: *The Bus Station, a [[Roadside Station]] *The Children's Library *The Entsuba Memorial Museum. The town's special product is dried [[persimmon]]s. The town was founded on February 1, 1955. ==External links== * [http://www.city.onomichi.hiroshima.jp/ Onomichi official website] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Hiroshima Prefecture]] {{Hiroshima-geo-stub}}
